thread.title: What's happening on Halloween in Las Vegas |
thread.title_full: What's happening on Halloween in Las Vegas | Las Vegas Review-Journal

author: Dave Herrera
title: What's happening on Halloween in Las Vegas |
text:
Halloween is only a couple weeks away. Have you picked out your costume yet? What about your party plans? Have you crafted your itinerary yet? They kind of go hand and hand, don’t they? After all, what good is having a killer getup if you don’t have somewhere to show it off, right? Luckily, there’s still plenty of time to work on both.
With regard to your the second part of that equation, you’ve got plenty of options, depending on how you want to spend your evening. Feel like preoccupying yourself with a night of pristine pop? You’ve got Britney, Chris Brown and Omarion appearing on the Strip. If you’d prefer to dance yourself silly until the wee hours, Avicii, Kaskade, Skrillex and more are here to provide the soundtrack. Rather rock out to edgier tunes custom-fitted for a night like Halloween ? How about Rob Zombie and Danzig, Ghost or Skinny Puppy? Keep reading for a full rundown of what’s happening on Halloween weekend in Las Vegas.
Britney Spears Piece of Me at the Axis at Planet Hollywood
Friday, Oct. 30 and Saturday, Oct. 31
Tickets $57-$500, $62-$500

Friday, Oct. 30 and Saturday, Oct. 31
Tickets $42.50-$50 (sold out)
